title: Linux lastb Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux lastb command, which displays information about failed login attempts. Learn how to analyze login failures and enhance system security.

meta.title: Linux lastb Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux lastb command, which displays information about failed login attempts. Learn how to analyze login failures and enhance system security.
meta.keywords: Linux, lastb, login, security, failed login, user management, permission management

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the lastb Command

verify.name: Verify the lastb command output
verify.hint: The lastb command output should contain the user 'labex' in the list of failed login attempts.

steps.title: Explore the Syntax and Options of the lastb Command

verify.name: Verify the lastb command options
verify.hint: The lastb command output with the -d and -n options should contain the terminal information (e.g., tty1).

steps.title: Analyze Failed Login Attempts Using the lastb Command

verify.name: Verify the lastb command output for failed login attempts
verify.hint: The lastb command output with the -n 10 option should contain failed login attempts for the 'labex' user.
